prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I ain't no liar. I never met Glen Elg.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: There was some lame guy with that name, though. Wanted to borrow cash from me.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: I set up a meetin' with the guy... at my office, Tender Lender.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I waited around for him, but he ain't ever showed.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: I ain't never been to that Tres Bien joint, youse hear?
Person: Tigre

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. Let's start by going through each testimony and checking against the evidence to find contradictions.

Looking at the testimonies first. The testimonies are from Tigre (Furio Tigre). Let's check each one:

Testimony 0: Tigre says he never met Glen Elg. But Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar, which has a note on Dec 3rd saying "Meet with The Tiger". Since Tigre is known as "The Tiger", this suggests they had a meeting scheduled. That contradicts his statement.

Testimony 1: He mentions a guy wanting to borrow cash. Evidence 20 again supports that there was a meeting set, so maybe not a direct contradiction here.

Testimony 2: He says he set up a meeting at his office, Tender Lender. Evidence 20 says Glen had a meeting with The Tiger, so that aligns, no contradiction.

Testimony 3: He claims he waited but Glen didn't show. However, Evidence 6 (Small Bottle) has fingerprints of Furio Tigre. The bottle was found in the kitchen of Tres Bien. If Tigre was never at Tres Bien (as per Testimony 4), how did his fingerprints get there? So Testimony 4 says he never went to Tres Bien, but Evidence 6's fingerprints place him there. That's a contradiction.

Wait, Testimony 4 is Tigre saying he's never been to Tres Bien. Evidence 6 (Small Bottle) is found in the kitchen of Tres Bien with his fingerprints. So that directly contradicts his testimony. That's a clear contradiction.

Another possible contradiction: Testimony 3 says Glen didn't show up to the meeting. But Evidence 3 (Sports Paper) has a doodle by the victim mentioning 'MC Bomber' and '100,000' crossed out. Also, Evidence 23 (MC Bomber) is a virus made by Glen, found at Tender Lender. If Glen didn't go to Tender Lender, how did MC Bomber get there? But maybe Tigre took it after Glen's death. Not sure. The main contradiction is Testimony 4 and Evidence 6.

So the pair would be Evidence 6 (Small Bottle) and Testimony 4 (Tigre's claim he never went to Tres Bien). Because his fingerprints are on the bottle found there, which he couldn't have touched unless he was present.

{"evidence": 6, "testimony": 4}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided. The characters and evidences are from a Phoenix Wright case, probably "Recipe for Turnabout". 

First, let me look through the testimonies. The testimonies are all from Tigre (Testimony 0 to 7). He claims he loaned Glen Elg $100,000, was about to collect, but Glen won the lottery, so Tigre didn't need to kill him because the business was over once Maggey was framed.

Now, checking the evidences. Evidence 3 is a sports paper with a doodle by the victim. The doodle says 'MC Bomber' pointing to 100,000 crossed out, with 'ahahaha'. Evidence 20 is Glen's calendar note to meet "The Tiger" on Dec 3. Evidence 6 is a small bottle (ear medicine) with Furio's fingerprints. Evidence 23 is MC Bomber, a virus worth millions made by Glen. Evidence 20's calendar note shows Glen had a meeting with Tigre that day. 

Tigre's Testimony 0 says he loaned Elg $100k. But Evidence 3's doodle shows the victim crossed out 100,000 and wrote MC Bomber, which is a virus worth millions. So maybe Glen was planning to pay back with the virus instead of the lottery ticket. But Tigre didn't mention the virus, only the lottery. Also, Testimony 4 says Glen won the lottery, but Evidence 23 shows he had a virus worth millions. So if Glen had the virus, he could have used that to pay Tigre, contradicting Tigre's claim that he only wanted the $100k. 

Wait, Tigre says in Testimony 7 that he was after the $100k and had no other reason to kill. But Evidence 23 shows that Glen's virus was worth millions. If Tigre knew about MC Bomber, he might have a motive to kill Glen to take the virus. However, the calendar note (Evidence 20) shows they were meeting, so Tigre might have known about the virus. This would contradict Tigre's testimony that he only wanted the $100k. The doodle in Evidence 3 (crossed out 100k and MC Bomber) suggests that the victim was planning to use the virus as payment, which is more than 100k. So Tigre's claim that he only wanted the 100k is contradicted by the existence of the more valuable virus, giving him a bigger motive. 

Alternatively, Evidence 6 is the small bottle with Tigre's fingerprints. If Tigre claims he didn't have any other reason to kill, but his fingerprints are on the victim's medicine, that suggests he tampered with it, which would be a reason. But the testimony in question is Testimony 7 where he says he didn't have another motive. So if the evidence shows he did have contact with the victim's medicine (possibly poisoning), that contradicts his testimony. 

Wait, Evidence 6 is the victim's ear medicine, found in the kitchen with Tigre's fingerprints. The victim died from potassium cyanide in the coffee (Evidence 13). If Tigre handled the ear medicine, maybe he switched it with poison? But the cyanide was in the coffee. Alternatively, the ear medicine might have been a way to frame someone else. But according to the autopsy, death was due to potassium cyanide in the coffee. The ear medicine's fingerprints from Tigre could indicate he was present in the kitchen, which might contradict his alibi or show he had access to the scene. 

But the testimonies in question are Tigre's. Let's check his Testimony 7: "I was after the $100,000. I didn't have no other reason to kill the guy!" But Evidence 6 shows his fingerprints on the victim's ear medicine bottle. If he had no other reason, why was he handling the victim's medicine? This could suggest he was involved in tampering, giving him another motive (like if he wanted to kill Glen to get the virus, which is worth millions). So the contradiction is between Tigre's Testimony 7 (no other motive) and Evidence 23 (MC Bomber worth millions) or Evidence 3 (doodle about MC Bomber replacing 100k). Alternatively, Evidence 20 (meeting with The Tiger) could support that. 

Wait, Evidence 23 is the MC Bomber virus found at Tender Lender, made by Glen. If Tigre knew about this, he would have a motive to kill Glen to take the virus. But Tigre says he only wanted the 100k, but the virus is worth millions. So if he had access to the virus, that's a bigger motive. However, the testimonies don't mention the virus. But Evidence 3's doodle shows the victim was thinking of the virus (MC Bomber) in relation to 100k. So perhaps Glen was planning to give the virus to Tigre instead of the 100k, but Tigre didn't mention that. 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 4 by Tigre: He says Glen won the lottery (half a million). But Evidence 14 is the winning ticket found on Maggey. However, if Tigre knew Glen had the virus worth millions, why would he care about the 500k lottery? That could be a contradiction. Tigre's motive would be stronger with the virus. But I need to find a direct contradiction between a testimony and evidence. 

Looking at Testimony 7: Tigre claims he only wanted 100k. But Evidence 20 (Glen's calendar) shows he was meeting Tigre on the day. If Tigre was there to collect 100k, but the victim had a virus worth millions, maybe Tigre's motive was actually to get the virus. Therefore, Testimony 7 (only 100k motive) is contradicted by Evidence 23 (virus worth millions) and Evidence 20 (meeting). 

But how to pair testimony and evidence. The key contradiction would be that Tigre claims he had no other reason, but there's evidence of a larger motive. 

Another angle: Testimony 1 says "we was due to have a little chat. The kid had hit his payback date". If Glen was supposed to pay back 100k, but he had the lottery ticket (500k) and the virus (millions), maybe Tigre killed him to take the virus. But Tigre says in Testimony 5 and 6 that thanks to Maggey's actions, his business with Glen was over (because the ticket was found on her, implying Glen couldn't pay). But if Glen had the virus, Tigre would still have a reason to kill him to get it. 

Alternatively, the key contradiction is in Testimony 7 where Tigre says he had no other motive, but Evidence 23 shows that he had access to MC Bomber (since it was found at Tender Lender, his company). So if Tigre knew about the virus, he could have a motive to kill Glen to take it. Therefore, Evidence 23 contradicts Testimony 7. 

Alternatively, Evidence 3's doodle shows that the victim crossed out 100k and wrote MC Bomber, implying that instead of paying 100k, he would use the virus. So if Tigre was aware of that, his claim of only wanting 100k is contradicted. But Tigre's testimonies don't mention the virus. So the contradiction is between Testimony 0 (loaned 100k) and Evidence 3 (victim's note about MC Bomber), but that's not directly a contradiction. 

Wait, Testimony 4: Tigre says Glen won the lottery, which is why he didn't need to kill him. But Evidence 23 is the virus worth millions. If Glen had the virus, Tigre could have a bigger motive. So Tigre's Testimony 7 (no other reason) is contradicted by Evidence 23 (presence of the virus which is more valuable). Therefore, the pair is Evidence 23 and Testimony 7. 

But I need to check the exact wording. Testimony 7 says Tigre was after the 100k and had no other reason. Evidence 23 is the virus worth millions, which Tigre's company had. If Tigre had the virus, he might have killed Glen to prevent him from selling it elsewhere, thus making Tigre the owner. That's a motive. So Testimony 7's claim of no other reason is contradicted by Evidence 23. 

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 6: Small bottle (ear medicine) with Tigre's fingerprints. If Tigre says he had no other reason, but his fingerprints are on the victim's medicine, that suggests he was involved, which contradicts his testimony. Because if he had no reason to interact with the victim's medicine, why are his prints there? So Evidence 6 (fingerprints) contradicts Testimony 7 (no other motive). 

Yes, that's a direct contradiction. Tigre claims he had no other reason to kill, but his fingerprints are on the victim's medicine bottle found in the kitchen. If he had no reason to be there, why are his prints on the bottle? This suggests he was present and handled the medicine, implying involvement beyond just the loan. So the contradiction is between Testimony 7 and Evidence 6. 

But let me check Evidence 6's description: "Small Bottle: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from others. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints." So the evidence directly links Tigre to the victim's medicine. If he claims he had no other reason to be involved, but his fingerprints are on the medicine, that's a contradiction. 

Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 6 and Testimony 7. Because Tigre says he didn't have another reason, but his fingerprints on the victim's item suggest otherwise.

{"evidence": 6, "testimony": 7}
